REL2000 - Introduction to Religion and C.name: REL2000 - Introduction to Religion and Cultural Studies

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction to the fields of religion and cultural studies explored from various disciplinary perspectives with attention given to the relationship between religion and popular culture.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Basic features and historical background of Confucianism, Taoism, Hinduism, Buddhism, Judaism, Christianity, and Islam.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Permission of Honors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Basic features and historical background of Confucianism, Taoism, Hinduism, Buddhism, Judaism, Christianity, and Islam. Honors-level content.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: A grade of 'C' (2.0) or better in REL 2000 or REL 2300; or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Basic concepts and issues associated with interfaith and interreligious studies.

REL3076 - Cults, Minority Religions, and.name: REL3076 - Cults, Minority Religions, and New Religious Movements

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: REL 2000 or REL 2300 or equivalent

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Theoretical and methodological issues in studying minority religions and new religious movements, including history, internal structure, socio-cultural relevance of particular cults or alternative religious movements.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: REL 2000, REL 2300 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Religion in popular culture & popular culture as non-traditional religion by means of various postmodern, theoretical perspectives with emphasis on religious dynamics in secular culture.

REL3111 - Religion and Philosophy Throug.name: REL3111 - Religion and Philosophy Through Film

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: ENC 1102 and either PHI 2010 or REL 2300 or FIL 1000.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Religious & philosophical themes encountered in contemporary film. It unites religion, philosophy & film by means of a critique of cultural productions of meaning, value and purpose.

REL3115 - Religion, Spirituality, and Po.name: REL3115 - Religion, Spirituality, and Popular Music

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Contemporary spiritual sensibilities encountered at the intersection of religion, philosophy, and popular music.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: REL 2300 or REL 2000.

Course Description.text: Examines both the Euro-American assimilation of Asian religions and immigrant Asian religious communities. Explores cross-cultural exchange, religious innovation and cultural appropriation.

Complete the following: 
REL2300 - World Religions (3)

Complete the following:

Course Description.text: Christianity & the history of associated beliefs, rituals, & art with attention to issues concerning human nature, social justice, the state, just war, science, & attitudes toward women.

Complete the following:
